metadata.title: io.vertx:vertx-core: memory leak when a TCP server is configured with TLS and SNI support (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A vulnerability in the Eclipse Vert.x toolkit causes a memory leak in TCP servers configured with TLS and SNI support. When processing an unknown SNI server name assigned the default certificate instead of a mapped certificate, the SSL context is erroneously cached in the server name map, leading to memory exhaustion. This flaw allows attackers to send TLS client hello messages with fake server names, triggering a JVM out-of-memory error. 
            STATEMENT: This affects only TLS servers with SNI enabled.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
vertx-core is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
